commonSentences: ++The patient had a [+[customDropdown:IV Size:14G,16G,18G,20G,22G,24G] IV placed in the [customDropdown:IV Location:left arm,right arm,left hand,right hand]].

The patient was on a ventilator [customDropdown:Ventilator Mode:AC,PC,PSV,CPAP] with the following settings: pressure control [text:Pressure], rate [text:Rate], FiO2 [text:FiO2], PEEP [text:PEEP], and tidal volume [text:Tidal Volume].
The patient was on [text:Rate]LPM O2 via [customDropdown:O2 Delivery Device:Nasal Cannula,High Flow Nasal Cannula,Simple Mask,Non-Rebreather Mask,CPAP,Venturi Mask].

The patient's GCS was assessed as [text:GCS] ([customDropdown:GCS Eye:4 (Spontaneously),3 (To verbal command),2 (To pain),1 (No eye opening),NT (Not Testable)],[customDropdown:GCS Verbal:5 (Oriented),4 (Confused),3 (Inappropriate words),2 (Incomprehensible sounds),1 (No verbal response),NT (Not Testable)],[customDropdown:GCS Motor:6 (Obeys commands),5 (Localizes pain),4 (Withdraws from pain),3 (Flexion to pain),2 (Extension to pain),1 (No motor response),NT (Not Testable)]).
The patient's belongings, which included: [text:Belongings], were left [customDropdown:Belongings Location:with the patient,with the family,with staff at the receiving facility].
The patient was on a cardiac monitor for the duration of transport, with the following findings: [text:Cardiac Monitor Findings].
+The patient was transported with the following IV medications from the sending facility: [+\n[text:Facility Medication] at [text:Rate]].

+During transport, the patient was administered the following medications: [+\n[text:Dosage] of [customDropdown:Medication] via [text:Route] at [text:Time]] \nby [customDropdown:Provider] due to [text:Reason for Medication]. The patient [customDropdown:Medication Response:responded well,had no response,had an adverse reaction] to the medications.

Assistance Info: EMS Crew x2 and Facility Staff x1
EMS Crew x2 and Facility Staff x2
EMS Crew x2 and Facility Staff x3
EMS Crew x2 and Facility Staff x4
Medical Necessity: 1: Patient was bed confined before and after transport
2: Patient required Cardiac / Hemodynamic monitoring during transport
3: Patient is confused, combative, lethargic, or comatose
5: Patient is a danger to self or others - requires monitoring
6: Patient has DVT required elevation of lower extremity
7: Patient requires IV Medications / Fluids during transport
8: Patient has moderate to severe pain upon movement
9: Patient is morbidly obese and requires additional personnel / equipment
11: Patient requires orthopedic device requiring special handling in transit
12: Patient requires or medical provider anticapates restraints (Physical or Chemical)
13: Patient has a risk of falling off wheelchair or stretcher while in motion
15: Patient requires special handling en route - Isolation
16: Patient requires assistance for administration / regulation of oxygen
17: Patient is unable to maintain seated position for time needed to transport
18: Patient is unable to sit in chair or wheelchair due to decubitus ulcer
19: Patient requires transfer for higher level of care; First hospital lacks equipment / services

sentences.text: [customDropdown:Unit #] was dispatched to [customDropdown:Sending Facility] for [text:Age] [customDropdown:Age Unit:year-old, month-old] [customDropdown:Gender].
Upon arrival, the patient’s condition was [customDropdown:Initial Condition:stable,stable and within normal limits].

tabs.title: No Immediate Intervention
tabs.text: No immediate intervention or additional resources were required.

tabs.title: Immediate Intervention
tabs.text: Immediate intervention was required due to [text:Reason for Intervention], and included [text:Intervention].

narrativeSections.tooltip: Chief complaint at the time of EMS transport.

tabs.title: Complaint
tabs.text: The patient’s chief complaint is [text:Chief Complaint], which has been ongoing for [text:Duration] [customDropdown:Duration Units:minutes, hours, days, weeks, months, years].

tabs.title: No Complaint
tabs.text: The patient had no stated complaint at the time of EMS transport.

narrativeSections.tooltip: History of present illness, including any pertinent medical history.

sentences.text: The patient was recently [customDropdown:Hospitalized / Evaluated] for [text:Reason].
The patient’s medical history, medications, and allergies are detailed in the HPI.
The patient’s mental status was assessed as [customDropdown:Mental Status], with ABCs evaluated as [customDropdown:ABCs:noted in assessment].
Primary assessment findings, documented in the treatment tab, revealed [text:Assessment Status].
Advanced Life Support (ALS) assessment was performed by [customDropdown:Provider].
Basic Life Support (BLS) assessments were conducted by [customDropdown:Provider].

narrativeSections.tooltip: Reassessment of the patient’s condition and any interventions performed.

sentences.text: The patient’s vital signs, along with any performed interventions, are detailed in the treatment section.

tabs.title: No Interventions
tabs.text: No additional interventions were necessary to manage the patient's condition during transport.

tabs.title: Interventions
tabs.text: Additional interventions were necessary to manage the patient’s condition due to [text:Additional Reason], and these included [text:Interventions].

sentences.text: The patient’s condition [customDropdown:Patient Condition] during transport.

narrativeSections.tooltip: Transport information, including the method of transport and any complications.

tabs.title: Option 1
tabs.text: The patient was transferred to the stretcher via [customDropdown:Method] with assistance [customDropdown:Assist Count], secured with [customDropdown:Straps Count] straps, and loaded into [customDropdown:Unit #], without complications.

tabs.title: Option 2
tabs.text: The patient was transferred to the stretcher via [customDropdown:Method] with assistance of [customDropdown:Assistance Info], secured to stretcher with all available straps and side rails raised, and loaded into [customDropdown:Unit #], without complications.

sentences.text: The patient was transported to [customDropdown:Receiving Facility].
Upon arrival, the patient’s condition was [customDropdown:Arrival Condition:stable,stable and within normal limits].

tabs.title: Option 1
tabs.text: The patient was transferred to [customDropdown:Transfer of Location] via [customDropdown:Method] with assistance [customDropdown:Assist Count], without complications.

tabs.title: Option 2
tabs.text: The patient was transferred to [customDropdown:Transfer of Location] via [customDropdown:Method] with assistance of [customDropdown:Assistance Info], without complications.

sentences.text: A full report was provided to [text:Receiving Provider].

narrativeSections.tooltip: Medical necessity for ambulance transport, including the reason for transport and the receiving facility.

tabs.title: Necessary
tabs.text: The medical necessity for ambulance transport was justified because [customDropdown:Medical Necessity].

tabs.title: Not Necessary
tabs.text: There was no medical necessity for ambulance transport.

tabs.title: Interfacility
tabs.text: The patient was taken to [customDropdown:Receiving Facility] due to the need for [customDropdown:Reason] that [customDropdown:Sending Facility] was unable to provide.

tabs.title: To Residence
tabs.text: The patient was taken to their residence following discharge from hospital.

sentences.text: I, [customDropdown:Provider], hereby certify that the above findings are accurate and complete to the best of my knowledge.
